intro: Eschweilera pachyderma, commonly known as the thick-leaved evergreen, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to the rainforests of South America. It is characterized by its large, thick, leathery leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous seeds. Eschweilera pachyderma is often found in shaded, humid environments and is valued for its ornamental foliage.
